Evaluation du deuxieme projet routier - Tchad

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Highway Project consists of:
            (a) a five-year program for improvement and maintenance of
            about 800 km of feeder roads in cotton-growing areas; (b)
            preinvestment studies for improvement of about 120 km of
            secondary roads connecting cotton-growing areas with the
            main export routes; (c) a two-year training program for DPW
            staff; (d) technical assistance to the Ministry of Transport
            for reorganization of the road transport industry; (e) a
            two-year traffic count on about 2,000 km of the most
            important and heavily trafficked roads in the country; (f)
            reconditioning of nine ferry boats, and their interim
            maintenance over a three year period; and (g) a feasibility
            study for replacement of ferry boats and improvements to
            dock facilities.
